p: COVID-19 continues to spread globally, and a second wave of COVID-19 appears probable ( Leung et al., 2020; Price et al. 2019) thus, the effect of meteorological parameters on the spread of COVID-19 should be explored to help predict the development over the coming months, although numerous factors may affect the progression of the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, this study explored the effects of temperature and humidity on the daily new cases and deaths of COVID-19 in 166 countries using a generalized additive model ( GAM), to provide useful implications for policymakers and the public.
